comments.content:
The scope is more important. Oops you brought down our production servers because they werent in scope is more serious than management not being aware of pentesters doing their planned work on the appropriate systems.

Even if it's black box, you can still define a scope.

Whatever the type of penetration test, Management of the target organization MUST be aware of it.
Also, how do you match "The environment and penetration test scope have been determined" with Black Box Test?

discussion.content: D. The environment and penetration test scope have been determined.

Selected Answer: A
While other aspects, such as determining the environment and penetration test scope, are also important, ensuring that the management of the client organization is aware of the testing lays the foundation for a collaborative and transparent testing process. Therefore, it is typically the MOST important consideration when planning a black box penetration test.

Selected Answer: D
yeah i think its D.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST important to ensure when planning a black box penetration test?

choices.D: The environment and penetration test scope have been determined.
choices.C: Diagrams of the organization's network architecture are available.
choices.B: The test results will be documented and communicated to management.
choices.A: The management of the client organization is aware of the testing.

choices.B: Testing a sample of transactions to confirm updates were applied
choices.C: Verifying the timestamp from the job log
choices.D: Reviewing a copy of the script for the job
choices.A: Obtaining process owner confirmation that the job was completed

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I will change my answer to C:
While B. Testing a sample of transactions to confirm updates were applied is a valid method to verify the accuracy and completeness of updates, it is not as efficient or immediate as verifying the timestamp from the job log. Testing a sample of transactions involves additional steps and may not provide real-time confirmation of the batch update job's execution status.

Selected Answer: B
While verifying the timestamp from the job log (option C) can provide information about when the batch update job was executed, it does not directly confirm whether the updates were applied correctly. Timestamp verification alone does not guarantee the accuracy or completeness of the update process.
Isn't B the answer?

Selected Answer: B
should be B
I think answer is B

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST determines if a batch update job was successfully executed?

discussion.content: C. Risk-based auditing

comments.content:
Continuous isn't the most efficient because you're just continuously monitoring everything.

Risk based is better, because you're putting your focus on auditing the main areas that are at actual risk for the organization.

discussion.content: why not continuous auditing?

Selected Answer: C
Risk-based
C, Risk-based auditing focuses on identifying and prioritizing areas of higher risk within an organization's information systems environment.

questions.question_text: Which audit approach is MOST helpful in optimizing the use of IS audit resources?

choices.B: The quality of the implemented product will be assessed during acceptance testing.
choices.A: An independent auditor will be engaged to undertake a pre-implementation review.
choices.D: Independent quality assurance (QA) activities will be undertaken at various phases of the project.
choices.C: The quality plan will be assessed during the design phase of development.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST effective approach in assessing the quality of modifications made to financial software?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
option D is more accurate

Selected Answer: B
Why not B??
D. Independent quality assurance (QA) activities will be undertaken at various phases of the project.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should be an IS auditor's GREATEST concern when reviewing a business continuity plan (BCP)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Between the 2 options (a and c) the greatest concern is not testing the bcp. While option A is a significant concern, it can be addressed by updating the plan. However, even if all processes are included, without testing, the effectiveness of those processes remains uncertain.

Selected Answer: C
How do we confirm the correct answer?

Selected Answer: A
While the absence of evidence that the BCP has been tested (option C) is also a significant concern, ensuring that critical business processes are adequately addressed within the plan is typically the GREATEST concern for an IS auditor. Therefore, it should be the primary focus when reviewing a business continuity plan.
Who provides the answers on these questions?? Aee from the the Isaca? A lot of them answers are misleadinfy

Selected Answer: A
Only A

Selected Answer: A
A. Some critical business processes are not included in the BCP.

choices.A: Some critical business processes are not included in the BCP.
choices.D: An offsite storage location is not documented in the BCP.
choices.B: Business unit personnel are not aware of the BCP.
choices.C: There is no evidence that the BCP has been tested.
